body: Bootstrap is never tested otherwise, and LAN discovery is a prerequisite for everything else. Having these two tests lets us rule out or identify LAN discovery as a possible cause for test failures. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/764)

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion, all commit checks successful. --- *[auto_tests/bootstrap_test.c, line 18 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/764#-L4pPEJsMP8rnfCVPTMD:-L4pQstU9VKBc7GWNHZl:bnuagyh) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/84a5f354cd4e1789919615c8d862ec3f53e1cb2c/auto_tests/bootstrap_test.c#L18)):*
Previously, robinlinden (Robin Lindén) wrote…
Didn't this change to node.tox.biribiri.org?
Please use node.tox.biribiri.org even if the node is still reachable on biribiri.org. Also, why not create a local bootstrap node in the test itself and bootstrap off that? I think you can get the DHT key and the UDP port from tox.h, which is all you need for bootstrapping. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/764)*

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions, all commit checks successful.

---

*[toxcore/LAN_discovery.c, line 355 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/764#-L4pS0uTuAjq6TEtBq1c:-L4pS0uTuAjq6TEtBq1d:b-y34m1b) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/84a5f354cd4e1789919615c8d862ec3f53e1cb2c/toxcore/LAN_discovery.c#L355)):*
>Why should we reject discovery packets from outside the LAN?

Because this feature is called "LAN discovery", so it doesn't make sense to discover outside LAN.

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/764)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[toxcore/LAN_discovery.c, line 355 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/764#-L4pS0uTuAjq6TEtBq1c:-L4ptreAfZYz1Fpthuhm:blow35) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/84a5f354cd4e1789919615c8d862ec3f53e1cb2c/toxcore/LAN_discovery.c#L355)):*
Previously, nurupo wrote…
>Why should we reject discovery packets from outside the LAN? Because this feature is called "LAN discovery", so it doesn't make sense to discover outside LAN.
We're not discovering, but if someone advertises themselves as a bootstrap node via the LAN discovery packet, why not accept it? Concretely, this condition breaks LAN discovery on systems that aren't in a LAN (so it's just discovery). Again: why should we reject it? "Because of the name" seems like a weak reason. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/764)*

>Concretely, this condition breaks LAN discovery on systems that aren't in a LAN (so it's just discovery).

Breaks in what way, could you explain more?

>Again: why should we reject it? "Because of the name" seems like a weak reason.

The purpose of the LAN discovery feature is to do LAN discovery, which implies rejecting anything that is not on the LAN. You are not making sense with your statement. You can't have a feature saying that it does one thing but actually making it do something different. If you want a global discovery, then the feature should be renamed as that, not kept as LAN discovery.

I'm not sure but without rejecting packages outside the LAN intruder can create fake nodes and send a lot of fake "LAN discovery" requests to increase probability of using fake node to work with DHT.
If I'm wrong, still agree with @nurupo

If you have a public IP and someone sends you a LAN discovery packet on that IP, then you will send a "getnodes" packet to them. If you have a public IP and someone sends you a DHT ping packet, then you will send them a DHT pong packet. Either of those exchanges can lead to a DHT ping-pong connection (with occasional getnodes) being established. This is working as intended. There is no functional difference between the LAN discovery and the ping packet, so whatever you can do without this check, you can do with it.

commit.message:
Fix LAN discovery on FreeBSD.

Also, add an auto-test for bootstrap and for LAN discovery.

Bootstrap is never tested otherwise, and LAN discovery is a prerequisite
for everything else. Having these two tests lets us rule out or identify
LAN discovery as a possible cause for test failures.

Fix LAN discovery on FreeBSD.

Also, add an auto-test for bootstrap and for LAN discovery.

Bootstrap is never tested otherwise, and LAN discovery is a prerequisite
for everything else. Having these two tests lets us rule out or identify
LAN discovery as a possible cause for test failures.

title: Fix LAN discovery on FreeBSD.
